linearState.title: Test meeting extraction Slack notifications end-to-end in staging and verify channel mappings
linearState.description:
Enables E2E testing of meeting extraction Slack notifications + channel mappings.

PR #2275: Currently in review
Link: [https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2275](https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2275)
Author: drios-gather

Key changes supporting EXMR-739:

* meetingProcessor posts Slack summaries when operations succeed (includes per-issue links/identifiers)
* Uses Linear team → Slack channel mapping from ambient_extraction_channels
* Provides structured block formatting and plain text for readability
* Utilizes SSM-provided Slack bot token for posting

This should unblock staging tests to verify messages and channel mappings end-to-end.

linearState.title: Fix MCP in headless mode
linearState.description:
Documentation update to align MCP behavior in headless mode with working implementation.

PR #2262: Currently in review — [https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2262](https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2262)
Key changes:

* Update docs/acceptance-testing-action-spec.md to require the --mcp-config flag for Claude Code in headless mode; do not rely on \~/.claude.json or \~/.config/claude-code/settings.json.
* Build /tmp/mcp-config.json at runtime and pass via --mcp-config.
* Switch Browserbase MCP server to @browserbasehq/mcp-server-browserbase (via npx).
* Provide modelName openai/gpt-4o and modelApiKey using OPENAI_API_KEY.
* Add OPENAI_API_KEY to workflow secrets and propagate alongside BROWSERBASE_API_KEY and BROWSERBASE_PROJECT_ID.
* Update CI step to run claude with --mcp-config, --output-format stream-json, --verbose, and --dangerously-skip-permissions; capture conversation to /tmp/full_conversation.jsonl and extract final response to /tmp/test_results.txt.
* Update secrets checklist to include OPENAI_API_KEY.

Note: Original issue (AIVP-953) behavior addressed in PR #2261; this PR updates documentation to match the headless-mode configuration.

linearState.title: Restore Slack user → Linear user mapping to fix assignee assignment
linearState.description:
Restore Slack user → Linear user mapping to fix assignee assignment.

PR #2249: Merged on 2025-12-03
Link: [https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2249](https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2249)
Author: karenying

Key changes:

* Utils (src/utils/userMapping.ts): Implement mapSlackToLinearId using linearSlackUserMapping with flexible identifier matching; add reverse lookup mapLinearToSlackId returning UserMapping; introduce and export UserMapping type.
* Data/Primitives (src/primitives/linear-slack-user-mapping.ts): Add populated linearSlackUserMapping array of Linear↔Slack user records.
* Scripts (scripts/fetch-linear-slack-user-mapping.ts): New script to fetch users from Linear/Slack, produce mapping, and write JSON/CSV/TS outputs.
* Public API (src/index.ts): Export mapLinearToSlackId and UserMapping alongside mapSlackToLinearId.

Impact: Restores Slack→Linear assignee mapping, improving assignee accuracy during ticket creation and updates.

linearState.title: Enable ZDR for multi-turn agent conversations by preserving reasoning via encrypted_content
linearState.description:
Goal: Support Zero Data Retention (ZDR) mode for multi-turn agent conversations by preserving reasoning context client-side via encrypted_content rather than server-side storage.

PR #2229 (open): [https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2229](https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2229)
Devenv: [https://cc-devenv-2229.stg.getgrapevine.ai](https://cc-devenv-2229.stg.getgrapevine.ai)
MCP API: [https://mcp-cc-devenv-2229.stg.getgrapevine.ai](https://mcp-cc-devenv-2229.stg.getgrapevine.ai)

Key changes in PR #2229:

* Include reasoning.encrypted_content in OpenAI call include list to retrieve encrypted reasoning items
* Parse reasoning items from response.output and collect encrypted_content
* Return reasoning_items from \_process_response and \_agent_think; track them across turns
* Set store=false for ZDR compatibility; avoid relying on server-side state
* Prepend collected reasoning_items to subsequent request messages to preserve context in multi-turn flows

Test plan (from bot):

* Multi-turn conversation preserves reasoning via encrypted_content with response_id chaining
* ZDR-enabled org flow maintains context across tool calls and turns
* Single-turn regression check behaves as before
* Logs show reasoning_items extraction and prepending to additional_messages

linearState.title: Ungate and release Gong connector
linearState.description:
Refactor Gong backfill to fetch active Gong tenant IDs via ConnectorInstallationsRepository and add a repository method to query them.

PR #2267: Closed without merge on 2025-12-03
Link: [https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2267](https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2267)

Key changes in PR #2267:

* Cron job (src/cron/jobs/gong_backfill.py): Replace SSM/tenant DB logic with ConnectorInstallationsRepository.get_active_tenant_ids_by_type('gong') to determine tenants for backfill.
* Database repository (src/database/connector_installations.py): Add get_active_tenant_ids_by_type(connector_type) to return provisioned tenants with connectors not in 'disconnected' status via a control DB query joining connector_installations and tenants.
* Remove dependencies on SSMClient and tenant_db_manager from the backfill module.
* Continue publishing SQS backfill messages per tenant using GongCallBackfillRootConfig.

Notes:

* This PR was closed without merge; confirm if a follow-up PR supersedes these changes.

linearState.title: Review PR #2210 (yarn checkpoint support) and take another look
linearState.description:
PR #2227: Eval capture + yarn checkpoint fixes
Link: [https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2227](https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2227)
Status: Closed without merge

Key changes in PR:

* Eval capture (admin):
  * Backend: optional issueIdentifiers support; fetchSingleLinearIssue and fetchLinearIssuesByIdentifier in admin-backend eval-capture controller
  * Frontend: EvalCapturePage adds 'Linear Issue Identifiers' input, includes in payload, auto-dismisses success
* Core strategy/tools:
  * SingleAgentStrategy: frozen-state flow uses a mock linear_task_lookup tool and skips live API sections
  * Adds state to SimpleLinearIssue; prompts allow SKIP for “no actionable content”
  * MCP: createMockLinearTaskLookupTool to return frozen issues via lookup interface
* Schemas: make skipData.title optional in core and slack-bot
* Evals:
  * CLI: adds --accumulate mode; improved help/mode descriptions
  * Processor: supports default fresh-per-doc vs accumulated state; only accumulates when --accumulate
  * Comparison: improves SKIP matching (reason-based), ensures all expected ops are represented, preserves default thresholds
  * README/scripts: documents modes; adds checkpoints:accumulate; new example checkpoint datasets and truth files

linearState.title: Collect initial eval suite from real meetings and Slack threads (with ground truth and rubrics)
linearState.description:
PR #2255: Improve realness of eval capture for Slack messages + Linear context — Merged on 2025-12-03
Link: [https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2255](https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2255)

Key changes:

* Backend — Slack capture:
  * Extend parseSlackLink to return messageTs and optional parentThreadTs (supports reply URLs)
  * Add isHumanMessage and filter messages to human-only up to the linked timestamp
  * Revise fetchSlackThread to use parent thread ts, format with section headers (Earlier/New), fetch user display names, and return richer metadata counts
  * Update SlackMessage type with bot_id, subtype, thread_ts
* Backend — Linear issues:
  * Fetch first 20 issues with optional createdAt <= before filter and improved GraphQL vars/error handling
  * Use artifactTimestamp (from Slack/PR metadata/meeting) to bound issues
* Controller:
  * Compute artifactTimestamp for Slack/GitHub/Meeting flows and pass to Linear fetch
* Frontend:
  * Update helper text to say 20 most recent issues instead of 50

Result: The eval capture better mirrors real Slack threads and filters Linear issues by the artifact timestamp to improve evaluation realism.

linearState.title: Implement async post-extraction enhancement job for richer ticket details
linearState.description:
Enhance ambient extraction descriptions by adding a description enhancement phase to generate structured, higher‑quality ticket descriptions for CREATE operations, improving actionability and clarity for coding agents.

PR #2258: Currently in review
Link: [https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2258](https://github.com/gathertown/corporate-context/pull/2258)
Author: theonlyjohnny
Date: 2025-12-03

Key changes in PR #2258:

* Exponent Core: Adds utils/descriptionEnhancer.ts (enhanceOperations, enhanceTaskDescription) and exports types to generate structured descriptions (Summary, Context, Requirements, Technical Considerations when applicable, References) from source content; falls back to original on failure.
* Grapevine MCP client: Implements callAskAgentFast to invoke ask_agent_fast with reasoning_effort=minimal, verbosity=low, disable_citations=true; robust parsing of MCP response and guaranteed connection cleanup.
* Processors: GitHub, Meeting, and Slack processors now call enhanceOperations to improve CREATE operation descriptions in parallel; enhancement is source‑aware and only applies to CREATE.
* Strategy/Metadata: Enhancement is wired via metadata when processing ambient sources; evals remain unchanged to avoid performance impact.

Notes:

* Only CREATE operations are enhanced; UPDATE and SKIP are unchanged.
* Complements earlier work tracked in this issue (e.g., PR #2257) delivering the description enhancement capability.

linearState.title: Investigate incorrect issue routing to Exponent Mirror board (e.g., Intercom connector landed here)
linearState.description:
Investigate why issues like 'Create Intercom connector' appeared on the Exponent Mirror board unexpectedly.

* Inspect logs to trace the event(s) that placed EXMR-714 on the EXMR board
* Verify Slack channel → Linear team mapping and any fallback behavior
* Confirm Linear search/routing respects the specified team filter; add guardrails to prevent cross-team spillover
* Document root cause and implement fix

Notes (2025-12-02 LK standup):

* Phillip suggested using logs to understand what happened
* Karen/Kumail suspect routing/search scoping issues
